translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs
The Chapter with Sumedhā at the Head
In the city of Bandhumatī,🔽I was a water-carrier;
and with that I supported my children.
I had no gift to give,
in the unsurpassed field of merit;

analyzed: tena kammena su katena  tau atisamagacchaha
translated: By that deed well done,🔽I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven;
There I enjoyed the fruit of that deed,
set out with water.🔽I was the foremost of a thousand celestial nymphs,

analyzed: abhibhomi sadā aha  paññāsam deva rājūna  mahesittam akārayi

translated: I was the chief of fifty kings of the gods,
among the gods and among humans;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving water.
On a mountain peak or in a forest,
in the sky or on the ground;
There is no direction without water,
and the sky was covered over.

analyzed: mahā meghaḥ pavassati  kadācid nīyamānāya  ñāti saṅghena me tadā
translated: a great cloud rained down.🔽Sometimes, when I was being led away🔽by my relatives,

original: mahāmegho ajāyatha.🔽Uṇhaṁ vā pariḷāho vā,🔽sarīre me na vijjati;
analyzed: mahā meghaḥ ajāyatha  uṇham vā pariḷāhaḥ vā  sarīre me na vijjati
translated: a great cloud arose.🔽Neither heat nor fever🔽is found in my body;
and there is no dust on my body,
this is the fruit of giving water.
there is no more future rebirth for me.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving water.
Welcome indeed was it for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ udakadāyikā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam udakadāyikā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the nun Udakadātā recited these verses.

analyzed: udaka dāyikā atheriyā apadānam dasama  sumedhā vaggaḥ paṭhamaḥ
translated: The Story of the Elder Nun Udakadātā is the tenth.🔽The first sub-chapter on Sumedhā is finished.

analyzed: dīpa dā daka dā ca iva
